channel.title: €50 external HDD
channel.description:
Any advices on an external HDD, budget is around €50.
I was thinking about a Western Digital Elements Desktop 1TB. I've heard it's pretty good, but if you know a better one, please tell. It's mainly for storing photo's, and won't be accessed daily.

item.title: €50 external HDD
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Project Epic, post:1, topic:388262”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=484079.msg3546553#msg3546553 date=1301225793]
Can you get 1TB hard drives for 50€ there?
[/quote]

…Lold.
@ OP : You Probably cant… also, Do Not BUY WESTERN DIGITAL! I have had Nothing but a bad experience with it.[/quote]
I’m not 100% happy with WD either, the harddrive is great, but the power-cord is awful. I also had a problem with the file-system suddenly became corrupt, but I bet thats my own fault.

Apart from that, it looks nice and I would say it are decent as long you’re careful with the cord. But I would check MITBs tip, it may be the best option.

Read full topic

item.title: €50 external HDD
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I have the exact same external hdd, had it for around 6 months now and has been fine so far, read/write speeds are decent. It’s a good buy for the price.

Read full topic

item.title: €50 external HDD
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Generally, it’s cheaper and probably better to get either an external hard drive enclosure, or a dock, then just buy a hard drive to put in it.

Not necessarily I thought the same thing but when it came down to buying the cheapeast enclosure then the cheapest harddrive you ended up about the same with shitter hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: €50 external HDD
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Speljohan:

Protip: If you listen to anyone bitching about HDD’s breaking, you’ll end not able to buy ANY brand at all.

True. WD is a good brand. I’ll buy that one.

Teh Spede:

Can you get 1TB hard drives for 50€ there?

Yes. As a matter of fact, that one is €45,90 (ex shipping). It has a USB 2.0 connection though, but I doubt the users (it’s not for me) want a 3.0.

This search (if you can call it that) has put me in a bad situation. Long story short, I want a NAS but I’m not in the position to spend money :(.

Read full topic
